One day a timer will appear on the Steam front page.
No one knows it's purpose and Valve will remain silent as usual.
For days people speculate that the announcement of Half Life 3 is imminent.
When the timer reaches the last few seconds, it freezes on the number 3. For a moment nothing happens and the world watches in anticipation.
Suddenly Gabe Newell's face appears on the screen.
"Valve is proud to announce a long anticipated game from a series that the fans have been excited to return to for many years."
He pauses for a moment and smiles, "It was worth the weight."
Suddenly, men and women all over the world have earth shattering orgasms, all diseases are cured, world hunger is solved, and all wars instantly come to an end.
"I am pleased to announce Ricochet 2."

This is  a seriously underrated game. There should be a lot more people who play this. It's a very simple game where you throw disks to knock people off platforms or use a decapitation shot, you also have launches to shoot you to other platforms. You try to knock people off platforms to earn points. And that's about the whole game. It may be simple, but it's very addictive. It's sad how little people play this, the most I've ever seen was 7 people, and there's like 5 servers. There's 2 gamemodes, deathmatch and arena. Arena is a 1v1 to try and get the first to 3 points. Deathmatch is everyone on the server just goes insane and hits everything that moves.


TL:DR, good game, hardly anyone playes. So, get on this game already.
лучшая игра

The day that Valve s.h.i.t the bed! I refuse to even to just pretend this is good for the spicy meimei. While it proves that Valve was/is willing to take risks back when they made games it also shows that this was before they understood what made a good game before they were worthy of making a book on game design. 30 or 60 dollars (5.99 today) will get you 2 (or maybe theres only one map honestly cannot tell) maps and nothing else. No viewmodel for your frisbee that you throw to knock or bounce people off the stage as your run into arrows to bounce you around. You cannot manually jump. Annnd thats it. Only one person plays it and the rest of the time you'll face bots. The asthetic, sound and graphics are all terrible. Thats no exageration. The one thing this has going for it is there aren't any bugs but thats because there is so little happening and so little that you can do that it is impossible for anything to happen. 10/10

Ricochet, while the concept is fun, can get old pretty quickly. This would work better as part of another game, not a standalone project. There's not a lot of variety in how you can play the game, and the simplistic maps certainly don't help with this. Also, with people on multiplayer being nonexistent, playing this game with others is possibly a no-go at this point. This is one product from Valve you'd probably want to forget.
best game ever!!!!

A lesser known game among Steam (and also a definite buy if it's under a buck). 

Ricochet is one of those games you buy on an extreme sale, play for probably 20 minutes to half hour at a time, then leave it for a while. Doesn't mean it's a bad game.

Ricochet's game mechanics revolves around simple movement. The player can move side to side, back and forth but can easily fall off the platform they are on. Players are meant to jump platform to platform, but are only able to by stepping on the arrows at the edge of the platform. The arrows then launch the player into the air and towards another platform. A player in the meantime, can jump at the same time you can and both of you can end up colliding, falling into an abyss of darkness. Or, one player can hit the right mouse button and kill the other guy with a Frisbee The player has the ability to shoot a disk to decapitate the opponent. Some of the maps I have played so far are quite intriguing, but don't offer any significant background to gaze at.

It's quite a simple game, and you basically are going to get what you pay for. Servers aren't always full, but I've been fortunate enough at the times that I do jump on (Saturday during the day) that they are. [b]Graphics[/b] and [b]sounds[/b] aren't anywhere near today's capabilities, but if you are one to enjoy a good game concept and can stand old graphics, this game is for you.Rating for it back in 2000, 7.5/10

[b]Ricochet[/b] is an old-school multiplayer only game, an official Half-Life mod to be exact. The objective is to knock enemy players off of the board by throwing various projectiles (in the form of discs) at them, all of which have their own unique compounds and have to be collected around the map. The gameplay is simple, but when there are a fair number of people playing, it is fast paced and a lot of fun.  

It was never really a popular game then and it is far from being any more popular now, but it is a lot of fun to play with friends. The servers are empty nine times out of ten so unless you actually have people to play with, it's not worth acquiring [b]Ricochet[/b]. 

Buy it only if you are capable of playing it to it's full potential and you will have fun.

Шаг 3: понимаем что твой выше указанный комп лагает с голд соурс
Шаг 4: качаем это
Шаг 5: запускаем
Шаг 6: радуемся пустым блядь сука в рот ебал сервакам

My Grandfather smoked his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my mother said to him, "If you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate, you have to stop immediately." Tears welled up in his eyes when he realized what exactly was at stake. He gave it up immediately. Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was really sad and destroyed me. My mother said to me- "Don't ever smoke. Please don't put your family through what your Grandfather put us through." I agreed. At 28, I have never touched a cigarette. I must say, I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done it, because this game gave me cancer anyway.
Still waiting for Ricochet 2. 10/10

Ricochet really cops it.

It’s a multiplayer mod for [i]Half-Life[/i]’s GoldSrc engine in which one blond man with chiseled features is cloned dozens of times and jumps around on space trampolines in colourful jumpsuits, throwing razor-sharp discs that travel along a purely horizontal axis in the hopes of beheading enemies - who are also jumping around on space trampolines and are thus very difficult to hit through skill.

None of this explains the sheer amount of it that Ricochet cops - there are worse mods out there charging money and going relatively unmolested in terms of angry users tearing them to shreds. The reason Ricochet cops it is because it was made by Valve, the Big Boys™ behind [i]Half-Life[/i] and [i]Counter-Strike[/i]. In 2000, Valve’s name might not have carried the prestige it does today (even if modern Valve is the rotting corpse of something dead polished up with the nice shiny façade of a benevolent corporate god), but [i]Ricochet[/i] wasn’t copping it in 2000 because in the days before Steam and broadband internet, you were just happy to have a computer game.

The ire retroactively raised by [i]Ricochet[/i]’s blandness (and more importantly, it’s deadness) is an almost funny representation of the fallacy of worshipping companies. We all became absorbed by Valve’s catalogue (it was hit after hit for a while there) and developed an expectation that they have always and will always be the premier producer of digital entertainment. There are still die-hard Valve fans out there confident that [i]Half-Life 3[/i] will blow minds in an industry where fancy technology hasn’t been impressive for at least a decade.

It’s funny to look back at [i]Ricochet[/i] because it shows that your favourite game studio wasn’t always the top-notch example of polished, nuanced game design that they [strike]are today[/strike] were in 2011. All we need now is for something to come out that will tarnish the reputation of r/GamingCircleJerk’s dead idol for the present, too. Maybe some kind of Steam redesign that doesn’t address the issues that the platform actually suffers from and instead introduces some mildly different colours to its palette.

[h1] Рикошет в пустоту [/h1]

Ricochet - это незамыловатая аркада, где мы прыгаем по плаформам и пытаемся выбить других игроков за пределы арены броском диска, либо альт. атакой отсечь им головы. 
Вообщем-то кроме этих дисков у нас ничего больше и нет.

Что же до геймплея, то он уныл и однообразен. 15-30 мин. хватит, чтобы с лихвой насладиться этим "шедевром" от Valve.
Вкупе с пустыми серверами ситуация совсем удручающая.

Да и вообще, как можно продавать этот мод за 129 деревянных? Он, однозначно, не стоит своих денег и по хорошему должен идти бесплатно с HL.

Если у вас нет в коллекции Ricochet, то даже не стоит заморачиваться на его покупку, ибо это проходняк.
